author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Tamil Nadu Federation of Women Presidents of Panchayat Government organised a State Convention on Saturday.

Women panchayat presidents from the Chennai Metropolitan Area and 15 other districts of the State participated.

Addressing the gathering, Former POWERFIN Chairperson & MD Qudsia Gandhi said women were playing a key role in local administration.

Some of the resolutions passed at the meeting include devolution of all the 29 powers to panchayats, action on the recommendations of State Finance Commissions regarding devolution of funds to panchayats, funds and powers to implement Gram Sabha resolutions, repeal of powers vested with the Inspector of Panchayats including Section 205 of the Tamil Nadu Panchayat Act 1994.

The participants stressed the need for obtaining no objection certificates from the local administration before implementation of major infrastructure projects by the Union and the State government.

A number of presidents said the power vested with the District Collector to remove elected presidents was arbitrary and unconstitutional and must be repealed.

With regard to protection of common resources and waterbodies, the participants resolved to focus on powers for the Gram Sabha to decide on its usage.

The Convention recorded that successive Governments in Tamil Nadu had failed to strengthen panchayat government with 29 powers entrusted to them as per the Constitutional provisions.
title: Women panchayat chiefs meet
